fullText: This production, directed by Simon Godwin, finds the right balance between the play's melancholy and its comedy, creating a vivid sense of a world in transition.

bwwExcerpt: Though it stars that fine actress Diane Lane, is staged by the rising British director Simon Godwin and features a new adaptation by the seriously gifted young dramatist Stephen Karam ("The Humans"), this frenzied, flashy take on one family's mortgage crisis may be the most clueless interpretation of Chekhov I have seen.
